TopicTitle: game crash when I decouple the TR-38-D decoupler(the biggest one)

Articles.Content:
When I decouple that decoupler, either by activating it with staging or by clicking on it, the game crash.

I know I should put a log here, where can I put it?

post the log to Dropbox or Mediafire the copy the URL

e.g.

Url = www.example.com

to get it like this Logs

Add [uR-L=insert URL here].

then put at the end remember to add something telling us what the download is between the first ']' and the second '['

Also remember all HTML code with caps i did it without so u cood see

and dont put a '-' between 'R' and 'L'

like this?

thank you for your help!

PS: sorry if the log is quite long: it took me a few launches before making the game crash.

Edited December 18, 2014 by goldenpeach

post the log to Dropbox or Mediafire the copy the URL

I have this exactly bug. It's reproducible 100% - I built an outpost launcher yesterday and it crashes (well, hangs the thread on Linux/32bit) every time I separate or stage-separate the TR38D.

I've created a gist paste with the following 3 parts:

(1) KSP.log (nothing here, really)

(2) VESSEL part from persistent.sfs, so people can reproduce.

(3) a PATCH that I made to my persistent.sfs that changed the TR36D into a mini decoupler.

https://gist.github.com/sofar/b40760dacbdfab58a4b5

AFTER I patched persistent.sfs to "transform" the decoupler into a mini decoupler, staging correctly separated my vehicle (of course it left some struts floating which is likely what was the issue here to begin with).

In any case, modifying the decoupler type seems to help.
I'm having this same issue. I'll try to get a log.
Of course, you can also try to use a different decoupler and scale it up using tweakscale
